title: Ticket #3523: RFE: implement new function firstDefined() for classad language
description:
A common scenario with condor's use of classads is allowing values to override other values, when they are present. Currently, this is somewhat awkward, requiring expressions like this: 

ifThenElse(_condor_RequestCpus isnt undefined, _condor_RequestCpus <= Cpus, RequestCpus <= Cpus)

Having a function such as firstDefined() would allow the same use case to be written like this: 

firstDefined(_condor_RequestCpus, RequestCpus) <= Cpus

It would also scale nicely with larger priority hierarchies: 

firstDefined(_4th_override_RequestCpus, _3rd_override_RequestCpus, _condor_RequestCpus, RequestCpus) <= Cpus

Proposed semantics:

  • firstDefined() is proposed to accept an arbitrary number of arguments (zero or more)
  • It will return the value of the first expression (left to right) that evaluates to a value that is neither 'undefined' nor 'error'
  • short circuit: Once a non-error non-undefined value is encountered, subsequent expressions are not evaluated
  • firstDefined(), with no arguments, evaluates to 'undefined'
  • firstDefined({e1, e2, ...}) is equivalent to firstDefined(e1, e2, ...)
  • if all expressions evaluate to either 'undefined' or 'error', the return value will be 'undefined'

Proposed additional functions in suite:

  • firstNumeric()
  • firstValid() (first non-error?)
  • perhaps a variation that accepts a type as a parameter:, so return first expression that has the given type (string, int, etc)

Proposal for an additional operator with similar semantics:

  • e1 <op> e2 <op> ... is equivalent to firstDefined(e1, e2, ...)
  • suggestion - <op> = '?:'
